clinical_study.brief_title: Post-marketing Surveillance Study for Evaluation of Dotarem Safety

brief_summary.textblock: Guerbet conducted a non-interventional post-marketing surveillance study on its Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) contrast agent Dotarem (gadoteric acid/gadoterate meglumine). The aim of this study, which was conducted in accordance with section 67, paragraph 6 of the German drug regulation, Arzneimittelgesetz, was to gain additional insights into the diagnostic efficacy, reliability and safety of Dotarem in routine practice using the most up-to-date MRI techniques and application methods.

detailed_description.textblock: Diagnostic efficacy was assessed by the following endpoints: diagnostic value ("yes"/"no") and imaging quality (5-step scale from "excellent" to "very poor"). Safety was evaluated on the basis of the frequency and seriousness of adverse events that occurred following Dotarem injection.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of the MRI procedure to 30-60 min after

secondary_outcome.description: Diagnostic value was evaluated by answering "yes" or "no" to the following question "Were you able to make a diagnosis based on the test results ?"
Image quality was evaluated with a 5-step scale from "excellent" to "very poor" ("excellent/very good"; "good"; "average"; "poor" and "very poor")

arm_group.description: All included patients underwent MRI with Dotarem

study_pop.textblock: Adult and pediatric patients undergoing routine MRI using the MRI contrast medium Dotarem
